title: 108_s1061
content: The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes the appointment of additional bankruptcy judgeships in various districts, including New York, Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, North Carolina, and South Carolina. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in various districts, including Virginia, Michigan, Tennessee, Arkansas, Nevada, Utah, and Florida. One additional bankruptcy judgeship is authorized for the southern district of Georgia. SEC. 3. TEMPORARY BANKRUPTCY JUDGESHIPS. Authorization for additional temporary bankruptcy judgeships in various districts including Puerto Rico, northern district of New York, middle district of Pennsylvania, district of Maryland, northern district of Mississippi, southern district of Mississippi, and southern district of Georgia. One additional bankruptcy judgeship for the southern district of Georgia, vacancies occurring 5 years after appointment not to be filled, reappointment eligibility for judges with expired terms. Extension of existing temporary bankruptcy judgeships. The temporary bankruptcy judgeships in Alabama and Tennessee are extended until a vacancy occurs 5 years after the enactment of the Act. All other provisions of the Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 1992 remain applicable to these judgeships. SEC. 4. The bankruptcy judgeship shared by the southern district of Georgia and the middle district of Georgia will become a judgeship solely for the middle district of Georgia. SEC. 5. Temporary bankruptcy judgeships in Delaware and Puerto Rico will be converted to permanent judgeships. SEC. 6. Technical amendments will be made. Section 152(a)(2) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to adjust the district numbers for various regions. Section 152(a)(2) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to adjust district numbers in various regions, including Georgia, Maryland, Michigan, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, and North Carolina. In the eastern district of Pennsylvania, the district of Puerto Rico, South Carolina, the western district of Tennessee, the district of Utah, and the eastern district of Virginia, district numbers are adjusted by increasing them by one.
